item.title: Sunspark Mountain - Jan 02,2010
item.description:
There once was a point in time when I was standing out in the pouring rain I've extinguished the flames in my mind because now times have changed but that doesn't conceal the excruciating pain that was once a resident of my soul which was driving me insane even though I've survived this war things will never be the same the wounds may heal but the scars will forever remain I proudly wear them with pride like stains upon my heart because the man that you see now was once falling apart now I've found the heavenly light that has guided me through the dark in the corner of God's eye I swear that I could see a spark it was shining ever so bright and upon my heart it left a mark that has pushed me to strive on and succeed towards the path of my destiny to gain all the things that I need when you look at me you can see these words glowing gold in my eyes they speak nothing but truth they have no reason for telling lies word to the wise I've come to realize that life is no fun when you're living it in disguise
By Glenn McCrary
 
© 2010 Glenn McCrary (All rights reserved)


 



sun | spark | mountain | 2010
item.content:encoded:
There once was a point in time when I was standing out in the pouring rain I've extinguished the flames in my mind because now times have changed but that doesn't conceal the excruciating pain that was once a resident of my soul which was driving me insane even though I've survived this war things will never be the same the wounds may heal but the scars will forever remain I proudly wear them with pride like stains upon my heart because the man that you see now was once falling apart now I've found the heavenly light that has guided me through the dark in the corner of God's eye I swear that I could see a spark it was shining ever so bright and upon my heart it left a mark that has pushed me to strive on and succeed towards the path of my destiny to gain all the things that I need when you look at me you can see these words glowing gold in my eyes they speak nothing but truth they have no reason for telling lies word to the wise I've come to realize that life is no fun when you're living it in disguise
By Glenn McCrary
 
© 2010 Glenn McCrary (All rights reserved)

item.title: Airborne Assassin - Nov 27,2009
item.description:
I'm like an invisible toxin that can't be seen just relentlessly blowing in the wind to commit a homicide I'm very keen I have enough force to squash your internal organs like jelly beans I put that on everything I have a really bad addiction like smokers addicted to nicotine for chopping innocent people's heads off like the blade of a guillotine with enough impatience to kill a teen killer fiend I can feel the adrenaline rushing through my bloodstream 'cause I'm on the black team traveling at a velocity so fast you would think I'm on the track team no I'm not clean my hands are dirtier than Jason from Friday the thirteenth Like a tea kettle I can practically feel my anger to the point that it's blowing out steam in vertical streams only difference is that I cause air pollution sounds weird yeah I know it was meant to leave you in a state of confusion you can either be part of the problem or be part of the solution either way eventually we're gonna come to a conclusion at least try to put an end to my stealthy executions and stop having these imaginary illusions whatever you do just try not to breathe because once you inhale me I'm guaranteed to make your lungs bleed then I'll just keep on blowing mysteriously without a single feeling of guilt or greed looking for more opportunities to pounce on some fresh new prey there's no such thing as delay like the wild animals in the jungle I always get my way just like the slogan right up under the logo of BK y'all are like some little kids up in pre-k sitting in a room on Nintendo 64 playing some DK that stands for donkey kong I be lingering in the country like Brad Paisley doing the honky tonk badonkadonk dropping bodies left and right like a ladder being lowered from an emergency helicopter flight you're lucky you got away I guess tonight just wasn't your night
By Glenn McCrary
© 2009 Glenn McCrary (All rights reserved)


airborne | assassin | poetry | glenn | november | 2009

item.title: Poetic Nature - Nov 26,2009
item.description:
Lately it seems that I have been lacking inspiration the pillar of my imagination has vanished I can't focus I'm losing concentration desperate I am to banish these mental complications that are isolating and revoking my ability to express my emotions allowing these invisible hands to clasp around my throat choking my poetic spirit putting a strain on my never ending devotion forcing me to go out of my way and ask questions hoping to get some helpful suggestions but however I have learned a valuable lesson you can't go towards the inspiration you gotta let the inspiration come to you and eventually everything will come together and stick like paper and glue when this will happen I have no clue but when the opportunity strikes I take full advantage of it because it is so rich and fulfilling to capture, release and translate that moment into something beautiful I love it that's why I hold onto it so tight and never let it escape my sight for it gives me the motivation that I need to get through these lonely nights and help me continue to write despite the chronic writer's block that I've been having disrupting ideas from flowing through my head while maniacally laughing knocking me over causing me to fall fifty feet while heavily gasping which then leads into hyperventilation as I end up instantly collapsing into a deep coma that would take years for me to awaken from believe me I'm not faking after careful calculation this is the sum that I've come up with and I fear that it is what is damaging my word playing magic but on my life I wouldn't quit so what if every now and then I end up having a glitch all writers do it's a universal disease that haunts us until we can find a cure and breakthrough
By Glenn McCrary
© 2009 Glenn McCrary (All rights reserved)


poetic | nature | poetry | glenn | mccrary | november | 2009

item.title: The Glenn McCrary Show *Special Episode* - Jun 15,2009

item.title: The Glenn McCrary Show Episode #2 - Mar 21,2009
item.description:
I always have my head down looking at the ground Thinking that today is gonna be Another gloomy day So I pray To see that tiny ray of light peak from behind those dark clouds Sunshine brightens my day When life gets hard I love feeling the warmth of it on my face It makes me feel good to be alive I hate rain but plants need water in order to survive I still hate the rain because it represents that God Is going through rough times right now So I do whatever I can To put a smile on God's face again To give him the strength to face the day Because that's what I envision everyday Now I will close this poem out But I will be back without a doubt By Glenn McCrary © 2008 Glenn McCrary (All rights reserved)

Eternal | Sunshine | 2008 | Glenn | McCrary
item.content:encoded:
I always have my head down looking at the ground Thinking that today is gonna be Another gloomy day So I pray To see that tiny ray of light peak from behind those dark clouds Sunshine brightens my day When life gets hard I love feeling the warmth of it on my face It makes me feel good to be alive I hate rain but plants need water in order to survive I still hate the rain because it represents that God Is going through rough times right now So I do whatever I can To put a smile on God's face again To give him the strength to face the day Because that's what I envision everyday Now I will close this poem out But I will be back without a doubt By Glenn McCrary © 2008 Glenn McCrary (All rights reserved)

Eternal | Sunshine | 2008 | Glenn | McCrary
item.itunes:summary: I always have my head down looking at the ground Thinking that today is gonna be Another gloomy day So I pray To see that tiny ray of light peak from behind those dark clouds Sunshine brightens my day When life gets hard I love feeling the warmth of it on my face It makes me feel good to be alive I hate rain but plants need water in order to survive I still hate the rain because it represents that God Is going through rough times right now So I do whatever I can To put a smile on God's face again To give him the strength to face the day Because that's what I envision everyday Now I will close this poem out But I will be back without a doubt By Glenn McCrary © 2008 Glenn McCrary (All rights reserved)

item.itunes:subtitle: The Glenn McCrary Show Episode #2

item.title: The Glenn McCrary Show Episode #1 - Mar 14,2009
item.description:
She is something I hold so dear Though to her it will never be clear As I walk along this twisted road The way that I felt she will never know I met her on the sixth of May I thought that she would always stay With her I experienced my first kiss And that memory I will always cherish She always knew how to make me smile But now that she's gone nothing seems to make my day worthwhile I don't know what to do My heart is broken in two I loved her And I thought that she loved me back But it was just another case of unrequited love crawling on my back She's been gone for a year Of which seems an eternity I wanted to prove to her that I was the one But now everything is said and done I thought that she would be my girlfriend But she just wanted to be friends She played with my heart She fooled me into thinking that she liked me And now I'm torn apart And that's highly unlikely But it's better to have loved and lost Than never to have loved at all It's better than being a loner until the day that you fall Sometimes I wonder what it would have been like If I were ever to go out with her I'd gently kiss her on her neck and make out with her in the shower I'd cleanse her body with soap and water then afterwards I would be through I wonder how long our relationship would have lasted Maybe a year or two So I hear relationships are hard work and that there is more to relationships than I love you She was my lock I was her key I'd always unlock her heart at any time of the day To show her That she would never fade away Writing this poem makes me want to cry But I'm a man So I gotta keep the pain inside I can't let these feelings show I'm too ashamed for people to know And yet I'm posting this note Only to find a tiny ray of hope I never thought that I'd be this lonely Sitting in the dark Thinking of my one and only No

Unrequited | Love | 2008 | Glenn | McCrary
item.content:encoded:
She is something I hold so dear Though to her it will never be clear As I walk along this twisted road The way that I felt she will never know I met her on the sixth of May I thought that she would always stay With her I experienced my first kiss And that memory I will always cherish She always knew how to make me smile But now that she's gone nothing seems to make my day worthwhile I don't know what to do My heart is broken in two I loved her And I thought that she loved me back But it was just another case of unrequited love crawling on my back She's been gone for a year Of which seems an eternity I wanted to prove to her that I was the one But now everything is said and done I thought that she would be my girlfriend But she just wanted to be friends She played with my heart She fooled me into thinking that she liked me And now I'm torn apart And that's highly unlikely But it's better to have loved and lost Than never to have loved at all It's better than being a loner until the day that you fall Sometimes I wonder what it would have been like If I were ever to go out with her I'd gently kiss her on her neck and make out with her in the shower I'd cleanse her body with soap and water then afterwards I would be through I wonder how long our relationship would have lasted Maybe a year or two So I hear relationships are hard work and that there is more to relationships than I love you She was my lock I was her key I'd always unlock her heart at any time of the day To show her That she would never fade away Writing this poem makes me want to cry But I'm a man So I gotta keep the pain inside I can't let these feelings show I'm too ashamed for people to know And yet I'm posting this note Only to find a tiny ray of hope I never thought that I'd be this lonely Sitting in the dark Thinking of my one and only No

Unrequited | Love | 2008 | Glenn | McCrary
